agenda_items.title: Public Notice
Opening Prayer
Pastor Willie Davis of The Palm Church in Houston introduced by the Commissioner of Precinct 3.
Pledges of Allegiance
Appearances before court

Members of the public may attend, participate and/or address Commissioners Court in-person or may view the meeting through the following link: https://www.harriscountytx.gov/Government/Court-Agenda/Court-Videos. Members of the public who attend the meeting in-person may make comments by signing up to speak by completing an appearance request form, and submitting it one hour before the commencement of the meeting, the form can be found at https://appearancerequest.harriscountytx.gov. Speakers may address the Commissioners Court for up to one (1) minute in total, notwithstanding how many agenda items the speaker signs up to comment on.  Members of the public who sign up to speak about a topic that does not address a specific agenda item at a regular meeting will also be limited to one (1) minute and will address the Court after all agenda related comments have been made. For business court or special meetings, speakers may only sign up to address topics that pertain to posted agenda items. Members of the public are also invited to email their written comments to Commissioners Court at CommissionersCourt@hctx.net.

It is the intention of the Harris County Commissioners Court to provide open access to all members of the public of Harris County to express themselves on issues addressed by County government.  However, members of the public are reminded that the Harris County Commissioners Court is a constitutional court, created by the State with judicial, administrative and legislative powers.  As such, the Harris County Commissioners Court possesses the authority to issue Contempt of Court citations.  Accordingly, persons shall conduct themselves with proper respect and decorum in addressing the Court, in participating in public discussions before the Court, and in all actions in the presence of the Court consistent with the rules and procedures of Harris County Commissioners Court.  Profane, insulting or threatening language, and racial, ethnic or gender slurs or epithets will not be tolerated.  Those persons who do not conduct themselves in an orderly and appropriate manner will be ordered to leave the meeting and recognition to speak may be refused at subsequent meetings of the Court.  Refusal to abide by the Court’s Order may result in a Contempt of Court Citation.

Please refer to Public Notice for specific meeting as instructions are subject to change.

The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.

The Court plans to accept public comments from each speaker who signed up to comment on a Resolution at the time the Court takes up the Resolution. Resolutions and signing of resolutions will begin at 6:00 pm or upon completion of the regular order of business whichever is earlier.

Notice is hereby given that, prior to the adjournment of the meeting of Commissioners Court, the Court may consider and take action on supplemental agenda items and/or emergency or urgent public necessity agenda items.  

Supplemental items may be published up to 3 business days before the date of a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.  

Emergency or urgent public necessity items may be published up to one (1) hour before a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.

agenda_items.title: Public Notice
Appearances before court

Members of the public may attend, participate and/or address Commissioners Court in-person or may view the meeting through the following link: https://www.harriscountytx.gov/Government/Court-Agenda/Court-Videos. Members of the public who attend the meeting in-person may make comments by signing up to speak by completing an appearance request form, and submitting it one hour before the commencement of the meeting, the form can be found at https://appearancerequest.harriscountytx.gov. Speakers may address the Commissioners Court for up to one (1) minute in total, notwithstanding how many agenda items the speaker signs up to comment on.  Members of the public who sign up to speak about a topic that does not address a specific agenda item at a regular meeting will also be limited to one (1) minute and will address the Court after all agenda related comments have been made. For business court or special meetings, speakers may only sign up to address topics that pertain to posted agenda items. Members of the public are also invited to email their written comments to Commissioners Court at CommissionersCourt@hctx.net.

It is the intention of the Harris County Commissioners Court to provide open access to all members of the public of Harris County to express themselves on issues addressed by County government.  However, members of the public are reminded that the Harris County Commissioners Court is a constitutional court, created by the State with judicial, administrative and legislative powers.  As such, the Harris County Commissioners Court possesses the authority to issue Contempt of Court citations.  Accordingly, persons shall conduct themselves with proper respect and decorum in addressing the Court, in participating in public discussions before the Court, and in all actions in the presence of the Court consistent with the rules and procedures of Harris County Commissioners Court.  Profane, insulting or threatening language, and racial, ethnic or gender slurs or epithets will not be tolerated.  Those persons who do not conduct themselves in an orderly and appropriate manner will be ordered to leave the meeting and recognition to speak may be refused at subsequent meetings of the Court.  Refusal to abide by the Court’s Order may result in a Contempt of Court Citation.

Please refer to Public Notice for specific meeting as instructions are subject to change.

The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.

The Court plans to accept public comments from each speaker who signed up to comment on a Resolution at the time the Court takes up the Resolution. Resolutions and signing of resolutions will begin at 6:00 pm or upon completion of the regular order of business whichever is earlier.

Notice is hereby given that, prior to the adjournment of the meeting of Commissioners Court, the Court may consider and take action on supplemental agenda items and/or emergency or urgent public necessity agenda items.  

Supplemental items may be published up to 3 business days before the date of a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.  

Emergency or urgent public necessity items may be published up to one (1) hour before a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.
Adjournment.

agenda_items.title: Public Notice
Appearances before court

Members of the public may attend, participate and/or address Commissioners Court in-person or may view the meeting through the following link: https://www.harriscountytx.gov/Government/Court-Agenda/Court-Videos. Members of the public who attend the meeting in-person may make comments by signing up to speak by completing an appearance request form, and submitting it one hour before the commencement of the meeting, the form can be found at https://appearancerequest.harriscountytx.gov. Speakers may address the Commissioners Court for up to one (1) minute in total, notwithstanding how many agenda items the speaker signs up to comment on.  Members of the public who sign up to speak about a topic that does not address a specific agenda item at a regular meeting will also be limited to one (1) minute and will address the Court after all agenda related comments have been made. For business court or special meetings, speakers may only sign up to address topics that pertain to posted agenda items. Members of the public are also invited to email their written comments to Commissioners Court at CommissionersCourt@hctx.net.

It is the intention of the Harris County Commissioners Court to provide open access to all members of the public of Harris County to express themselves on issues addressed by County government.  However, members of the public are reminded that the Harris County Commissioners Court is a constitutional court, created by the State with judicial, administrative and legislative powers.  As such, the Harris County Commissioners Court possesses the authority to issue Contempt of Court citations.  Accordingly, persons shall conduct themselves with proper respect and decorum in addressing the Court, in participating in public discussions before the Court, and in all actions in the presence of the Court consistent with the rules and procedures of Harris County Commissioners Court.  Profane, insulting or threatening language, and racial, ethnic or gender slurs or epithets will not be tolerated.  Those persons who do not conduct themselves in an orderly and appropriate manner will be ordered to leave the meeting and recognition to speak may be refused at subsequent meetings of the Court.  Refusal to abide by the Court’s Order may result in a Contempt of Court Citation.

Please refer to Public Notice for specific meeting as instructions are subject to change.
Management and Budget
Request for approval of authorized budget appropriation transfers for the Flood Control District and certain county departments.
Universal Services
Request for approval of new vehicle control numbers and changes to attributes of certain VCNs for various departments.

Grants

Request by Harris County Resources for Children & Adults for approval to submit a renewal application to the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services/Substance Abuse and Mental Health Administration (SAMHSA) for grant funds in the amount of $1,800,000, with no required match, for the FY26-27 AWARE Harris Project.

Request by Harris County Resources for Children & Adults for approval to submit an application to the Office of the Governor/Criminal Justice Division for grant funds in the amount of $1,159,500.63, with a required match of $293,111.18, for the FY26-27 Continuum - TRIAD Home Safe (formerly TRIAD Child Sex Trafficking) Program.
Auditor
Request for approval of Audited Claims.
Tax Assessor-Collector
Request for approval of tax refund payments.
Purchasing

Request for approval of an award on the basis of successful negotiations with the best evaluated vendor(s) and that the County Judge execute agreements with AECOM Technical Services, Inc. in an amount of $2,459,473; HR Green, Inc., $2,225,935; Lockwood, Andrews & Newnam, Inc., $2,220,520; and Michael Baker International, Inc., $2,430,180 for professional architectural and/or engineering services to conduct a planning study for a countywide drainage master plan for the Office of the County Engineer (250139), MWBE Contracted Goal: 20.6%.
Request for approval of a project scheduled for advertisement and consent for Request for Proposal for emergency management services data platform for Public Health Services (250109).

Request for approval of a project scheduled for advertisement for consent for Request for Proposal on comprehensive maintenance and services for a liquid chromatograph quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometer system for the Institute of Forensic Sciences (250282).
Request for approval of a project scheduled for advertisement for professional engineering services to implement a prototype Harris County Road flood warning system (SMART) (250267).

Request that the County Judge execute a settlement agreement with Kirby Built, LLC in the amount of $23,735 for commercial picnic tables and trash cans for Precinct 1 to provide full compensation for goods and services provided under invoice number INVKSA7095.

Request that the County Judge execute a settlement agreement with BWI Companies, Inc. in the amount of $4,903 for assorted insecticides for Precinct 1 to provide full compensation for goods and services provided under invoice number 19196249.
Commissioner, Precinct 2

Request for approval of a scholarship fundraiser for the Houston Livestock and Show subcommittee Houston Metro Go Texan annual cookoff event on January 16, 2026, and January 17, 2026, at the North Shore Rotary Pavilion.
Commissioner, Precinct 4
Request for approval to pay Harihar Enterprises Inc, DBA Chateau Crystale, via check in the amount of $12,500.00 for venue rental for an event to be held on Wednesday, February 11, 2026.
Request for approval to pay LARRY GLENN JOHNSON, DBA CC Rider Band, via check in the amount of $1,200.00 for services of 2-hours live entertainment for an event held on Wednesday, February 11, 2026.
Miscellaneous

Request by Bracewell for approval of a Certificate and Notice of Intent for the issuance of Cultural Education Facilities Finance Corporation Revenue Refunding Bonds, Series 2026, to refinance the costs of certain facilities for Houston Methodist.
Executive Session

The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.
Resolutions
Request by the Commissioner of Precinct 4 for approval of a resolution recognizing February 17, 2026, as Lunar New Year.

There being no further business, the Commissioners Court adjourned at 9:01 A.M. 

The above and forgoing minutes have been read and examined by me and are a true and correct representation of the actions taken by Commissioners Court held on January 22, 2026.

On this the 26th day of February, 2026.        	                              Teneshia Hudspeth, County Clerk

The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.

Notice is hereby given that, prior to the adjournment of the meeting of Commissioners Court, the Court may consider and take action on supplemental agenda items and/or emergency or urgent public necessity agenda items.  

Supplemental items may be published up to 3 business days before the date of a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.  

Emergency or urgent public necessity items may be published up to one (1) hour before a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.

There being no further business, the Commissioners Court adjourned at 6:03 P.M.

agenda_items.title: Public Notice
Appearances before court

Members of the public may attend, participate and/or address Commissioners Court in-person or may view the meeting through the following link: https://www.harriscountytx.gov/Government/Court-Agenda/Court-Videos. Members of the public who attend the meeting in-person may make comments by signing up to speak by completing an appearance request form, and submitting it one hour before the commencement of the meeting, the form can be found at https://appearancerequest.harriscountytx.gov. Speakers may address the Commissioners Court for up to one (1) minute in total, notwithstanding how many agenda items the speaker signs up to comment on.  Members of the public who sign up to speak about a topic that does not address a specific agenda item will also be limited to one (1) minute and will address the Court after all agenda related comments have been made. Members of the public are also invited to email their written comments to Commissioners Court at CommissionersCourt@hctx.net.

Executive Session

Request by the Office of County Administration for an Executive Session for the reappointment of Patrick Mandapaka, with alternate member Richard Smith, and appointment of Luis Guajardo, with alternate member Faustino Benavides, as Harris County’s representatives and alternates to the Houston-Galveston Area Council Technical Advisory Committee.

The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.

There being no further business, the Commissioners Court adjourned at 9:09 A.M.

agenda_items.title: Emergency/Supplemental items

Notice is hereby given that, prior to the adjournment of the meeting of Commissioners Court, the Court may consider and take action on supplemental agenda items and/or emergency or urgent public necessity agenda items.  

Supplemental items may be published up to 3 business days before the date of a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.  

Emergency or urgent public necessity items may be published up to one (1) hour before a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.

It is the intention of the Harris County Commissioners Court to provide open access to all members of the public of Harris County to express themselves on issues addressed by County government.  However, members of the public are reminded that the Harris County Commissioners Court is a constitutional court, created by the State with judicial, administrative and legislative powers.  As such, the Harris County Commissioners Court possesses the authority to issue Contempt of Court citations.  Accordingly, persons shall conduct themselves with proper respect and decorum in addressing the Court, in participating in public discussions before the Court, and in all actions in the presence of the Court consistent with the rules and procedures of Harris County Commissioners Court.  Profane, insulting or threatening language, and racial, ethnic or gender slurs or epithets will not be tolerated.  Those persons who do not conduct themselves in an orderly and appropriate manner will be ordered to leave the meeting and recognition to speak may be refused at subsequent meetings of the Court.  Refusal to abide by the Court’s Order may result in a Contempt of Court Citation.

Please refer to Public Notice for specific meeting as instructions are subject to change.

Members of the public may attend, participate and/or address Commissioners Court in-person or may view the meeting through the following link: https://www.harriscountytx.gov/Government/Court-Agenda/Court-Videos. Members of the public who attend the meeting in-person may make comments by signing up to speak by completing an appearance request form, and submitting it one hour before the commencement of the meeting, the form can be found at https://appearancerequest.harriscountytx.gov. Speakers may address the Commissioners Court for up to one (1) minute in total, notwithstanding how many agenda items the speaker signs up to comment on.  Members of the public who sign up to speak about a topic that does not address a specific agenda item will also be limited to one (1) minute and will address the Court after all agenda related comments have been made. Members of the public are also invited to email their written comments to Commissioners Court at CommissionersCourt@hctx.net.

The initiative, Harris County Smart Reminders & Navigation Tool, is a combination of automated appointment reminders, two-way communication, and AI-enabled identification of client needs represents a promising, scalable approach to enhance the support we provide to pretrial supervisees. The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.

Notice is hereby given that, prior to the adjournment of the meeting of Commissioners Court, the Court may consider and take action on supplemental agenda items and/or emergency or urgent public necessity agenda items.  

Supplemental items may be published up to 3 business days before the date of a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.  

Emergency or urgent public necessity items may be published up to one (1) hour before a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.

There being no further business, the Commissioners Court adjourned at 4:45 P.M.

Executive Session
Request by the County Judge for an Executive Session, pursuant to Texas Government Code Sec. 551.074, for the purpose of discussion and possible action regarding the position of the County Attorney.

The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.
Adjournment.

The Commissioners Court may go into executive session, if necessary, pursuant to chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code, for one or more of the following reasons: (1) consultation with the County Attorney to seek or receive legal advice or consultation regarding pending or contemplated litigation; (2) discussion about the value or transfer of real property; (3) discussion about a prospective gift or donation; (4) consideration of specific personnel matters; (5) discussion about security personnel or devices; or (6) discussion of certain economic development matters. The Commissioners Court may announce that it will go into executive session on any item listed on this agenda if the subject matter is permitted for a closed session by provisions of chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code.

The Court plans to accept public comments from each speaker who signed up to comment on a Resolution at the time the Court takes up the Resolution. Resolutions and signing of resolutions will begin at 4:00 pm or upon completion of the regular order of business whichever is earlier.

Notice is hereby given that, prior to the adjournment of the meeting of Commissioners Court, the Court may consider and take action on supplemental agenda items and/or emergency or urgent public necessity agenda items.  

Supplemental items may be published up to 3 business days before the date of a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.  

Emergency or urgent public necessity items may be published up to one (1) hour before a meeting of Harris County Commissioners Court.

There being no further business, the Commissioners Court adjourned at 4:02 P.M. 

The above and forgoing minutes have been read and examined by me and are a true and correct representation of the actions taken by Commissioners Court held on November 13, 2025.

agenda_items.title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:
agenda_items.full_title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:

agenda_items.title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.
agenda_items.full_title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.

A member of the community wishing to address the board may do so in person or by live video via Zoom. For either method, a person who wishes to address the board must register with the Board Services Department by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Any supporting information (e.g., handouts) regarding the community member's concern shall be filed with Board Services by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Further details and instructions for registering to speak are available at: https://www.houstonisd.org/board-governance/board-meetings

The agenda packet for this meeting is available at:
https://houstonisd.legistar.com/calendar.aspx

agenda_items.title:
Any item that establishes, modifies, or deletes board policy may, at the board's discretion, be passed and become effective immediately following first reading.

The items on this agenda may be taken in any order.

Unless removed from the consent agenda in accordance with Robert's Rules of Order, Newly Revised, and/or board operating procedures, items identified within the consent agenda will be acted on at one time.

No agenda or district business will be discussed except as noticed below and any action will occur in the room open to the public. It is the intent of the district to have, and the meeting will have, a quorum physically present at this location. The above location will be equipped with video conference equipment.

If during the course of the meeting covered by this notice the board should determine that a closed or executive meeting or session of the board should be held or is required, then such closed or executive meeting or session as authorized by Chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code (the Open Meetings Act) will be held by the board at the date, hour, and place given in this notice or as soon after the commencement of the meeting covered by this notice as the board may conveniently meet in such closed or executive session concerning any and all subjects and for any and all purposes permitted by Section 551.071 through Section 551.089 inclusive of said Open Meetings Act.

Should any final action, final decision, or final vote be required in the opinion of the board with regard to any matter considered in such closed or executive session, then such final action, final decision, or final vote shall be at either:

a) the open meeting covered by this notice upon the reconvening of this public meeting, or
b) a subsequent public meeting of the board upon notice thereof, as the board shall determine.

Should any final action, final decision, or final vote be required in the opinion of the board with regard to any matter considered in such closed or executive session, then such final action, final decision, or final vote shall be at either:

a) the open meeting covered by this notice upon the reconvening of this public meeting, or
b) a subsequent public meeting of the board upon notice thereof, as the board shall determine.

agenda_items.title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:
agenda_items.full_title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:

agenda_items.title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.
agenda_items.full_title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.

agenda_items.title:
A member of the community wishing to address the board may do so in person or by live video via Zoom. For either method, a person who wishes to address the board must register with the Board Services Department by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Any supporting information (e.g., handouts) regarding the community member's concern shall be filed with Board Services by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Further details and instructions for registering to speak are available at: https://www.houstonisd.org/board-governance/board-meetings

The agenda packet for this meeting is available at:
https://houstonisd.legistar.com/calendar.aspx

agenda_items.title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:
agenda_items.full_title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:

agenda_items.title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.
agenda_items.full_title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.

agenda_items.title:
A member of the community wishing to address the board may do so in person or by live video via Zoom. For either method, a person who wishes to address the board must register with the Board Services Department by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Any supporting information (e.g., handouts) regarding the community member's concern shall be filed with Board Services by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Further details and instructions for registering to speak are available at: https://www.houstonisd.org/board-governance/board-meetings

The agenda packet for this meeting is available at:
https://houstonisd.legistar.com/calendar.aspx

agenda_items.title:
If during the course of the meeting covered by this notice the board should determine that a closed or executive meeting or session of the board should be held or is required, then such closed or executive meeting or session as authorized by Chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code (the Open Meetings Act) will be held by the board at the date, hour, and place given in this notice or as soon after the commencement of the meeting covered by this notice as the board may conveniently meet in such closed or executive session concerning any and all subjects and for any and all purposes permitted by Section 551.071 through Section 551.089 inclusive of said Open Meetings Act.

Should any final action, final decision, or final vote be required in the opinion of the board with regard to any matter considered in such closed or executive session, then such final action, final decision, or final vote shall be at either:

a) the open meeting covered by this notice upon the reconvening of this public meeting, or
b) a subsequent public meeting of the board upon notice thereof, as the board shall determine.

Should any final action, final decision, or final vote be required in the opinion of the board with regard to any matter considered in such closed or executive session, then such final action, final decision, or final vote shall be at either:

b) a subsequent public meeting of the board upon notice thereof, as the board shall determine.

agenda_items.title:
If during the course of the meeting covered by this notice the board should determine that a closed or executive meeting or session of the board should be held or is required, then such closed or executive meeting or session as authorized by Chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code (the Open Meetings Act) will be held by the board at the date, hour, and place given in this notice or as soon after the commencement of the meeting covered by this notice as the board may conveniently meet in such closed or executive session concerning any and all subjects and for any and all purposes permitted by Section 551.071 through Section 551.089 inclusive of said Open Meetings Act.

Should any final action, final decision, or final vote be required in the opinion of the board with regard to any matter considered in such closed or executive session, then such final action, final decision, or final vote shall be at either:

a) the open meeting covered by this notice upon the reconvening of this public meeting, or
b) a subsequent public meeting of the board upon notice thereof, as the board shall determine.

meetings.location: BOARD AUDITORIUM AND BOARD SERVICES CONFERENCE ROOM

agenda_items.title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:
agenda_items.full_title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:

agenda_items.title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.
agenda_items.full_title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.

agenda_items.title:
A member of the community wishing to address the board may do so in person or by live video via Zoom. For either method, a person who wishes to address the board must register with the Board Services Department by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Any supporting information (e.g., handouts) regarding the community member's concern shall be filed with Board Services by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Further details and instructions for registering to speak are available at: https://www.houstonisd.org/board-governance/board-meetings

The agenda packet for this meeting is available at:
https://houstonisd.legistar.com/calendar.aspx

agenda_items.title:
Any item that establishes, modifies, or deletes board policy may, at the board's discretion, be passed and become effective immediately following first reading.

The items on this agenda may be taken in any order.

Unless removed from the consent agenda in accordance with Robert's Rules of Order, Newly Revised, and/or board operating procedures, items identified within the consent agenda will be acted on at one time.

No agenda or district business will be discussed except as noticed below and any action will occur in the room open to the public. It is the intent of the district to have, and the meeting will have, a quorum physically present at this location. The above location will be equipped with video conference equipment.

No agenda or district business will be discussed except as noticed below and any action will occur in the room open to the public. The items on this agenda may be taken in any order.

Unless removed from the consent agenda in accordance with Robert's Rules of Order, Newly Revised, and/or board operating procedures, items identified within the consent agenda will be acted on at one time.

No agenda or district business will be discussed except as noticed below and any action will occur in the room open to the public. It is the intent of the district to have, and the meeting will have, a quorum physically present at this location. The above location will be equipped with video conference equipment.

If during the course of the meeting covered by this notice the board should determine that a closed or executive meeting or session of the board should be held or is required, then such closed or executive meeting or session as authorized by Chapter 551 of the Texas Government Code (the Open Meetings Act) will be held by the board at the date, hour, and place given in this notice or as soon after the commencement of the meeting covered by this notice as the board may conveniently meet in such closed or executive session concerning any and all subjects and for any and all purposes permitted by Section 551.071 through Section 551.089 inclusive of said Open Meetings Act.

Should any final action, final decision, or final vote be required in the opinion of the board with regard to any matter considered in such closed or executive session, then such final action, final decision, or final vote shall be at either:

a) the open meeting covered by this notice upon the reconvening of this public meeting, or
b) a subsequent public meeting of the board upon notice thereof, as the board shall determine.

meetings.location: BOARD AUDITORIUM AND BOARD SERVICES CONFERENCE ROOM

agenda_items.title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:
agenda_items.full_title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:

agenda_items.title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.
agenda_items.full_title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.

agenda_items.title:
A member of the community wishing to address the board may do so in person or by live video via Zoom. For either method, a person who wishes to address the board must register with the Board Services Department by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Any supporting information (e.g., handouts) regarding the community member's concern shall be filed with Board Services by 12:00 p.m. the day before the meeting. Further details and instructions for registering to speak are available at: https://www.houstonisd.org/board-governance/board-meetings

The agenda packet for this meeting is available at:
https://houstonisd.legistar.com/calendar.aspx

agenda_items.title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:
agenda_items.full_title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:

agenda_items.title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.
agenda_items.full_title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:
agenda_items.full_title:
The purpose of the Houston Independent School District School Board is to represent the vision and values of the community, and consistent with that, govern the administration of the Houston Independent School District in a manner that best allows for the improvement of academic outcomes for all the students we serve. The School Board must be able to do its work of governing, including deliberations and decision-making, in orderly meetings held open to the public.

In order to (i) ensure we can efficiently address the needs of our students, (ii) allow for necessary deliberations and discussions to occur, (iii) give all members of the public an opportunity to participate and observe the school board's meetings, and (iv) provide appropriate translation services for non-English speaking members of the HISD community, we will adhere to the following rules and norms:

agenda_items.title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.
agenda_items.full_title:
•	Public comment during School Board meetings will only be available to those persons who 	have signed up to speak prior to the meeting time per current protocol.
•	Verbal and other disruptions by persons during the School Board meetings are not 	acceptable as they inhibit the board’s ability to conduct business and the public’s ability to 	observe those processes. Persons who participate in such behavior will be given one 	warning and if the behavior is repeated, they will be asked to leave the meeting.
•	Seating in the board room is available on a first come, first served basis for all persons, 	including those who have signed up to speak during public comment. Overflow seating 	may be available, also on a first come, first served basis.

upcoming_schedule.note: Houston City Council typically meets Tuesdays at 1:30 PM and reconvenes Wednesdays at 9:00 AM. Next expected meetings based on pattern:

patterns_observed.tirz_budget_season: Multiple TIRZ/Reinvestment Zone budget ordinances across Jan 2026 sessions - FY2026 operating budgets and FY2026-2030 capital plans approved for ~10 zones
patterns_observed.water_infrastructure: Significant water/sewer infrastructure spending: waterline rehab contracts, lift station work, Trinity River Conveyance ($46.4M), water authority O&M budgets totaling ~$55M
patterns_observed.historic_preservation: Several landmark designation hearings and historic district changes in Jan 2026 - Heights East, Woodland Heights, multiple individual structures
patterns_observed.fleet_purchases: Multiple large fleet/vehicle purchases across sessions totaling tens of millions (police, public works, fire)
patterns_observed.park_transfers: Harris County taking over operation of Moody Park and Keith-Wiess Park from City
patterns_observed.consent_decree_work: Ongoing consent decree compliance for wastewater lift station rehabilitation
